posts.cooked:
Hi everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.87.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • Help keep important information easily accessible with pinned messages. Your most frequently asked questions, dinner reservations, and vacation itineraries are already top of mind. Now they can be top of chat as well.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.86.0-beta.1…v7.87.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.86 release
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.70 release

posts.cooked: Previous beta: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.86 release - #10 by Aku-Stable

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.86 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.87.0-beta.1

43 new commits since 7.86.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.87.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • CallScreen: On ringing screen, remove Avatar in center of screen [2]

  • View-once media: backend send support [3]

  • Add option to sort by file size in Media Gallery [4]

  • Exclude mentionAciBinary in processedRange [5]

  • Improve focus management for AxoContextMenu [6]

  • Fix focus state when forwarding [7]

  • Update Electron to v39.2.7 [8]

  • Add backup support for pinned messages [9]

  • Add expiration timer to pinned message notification [10]

  • Fix raised hand count showing 0 [11]

  • sendToGroup: Move to libsignal typed API [12]

  • Pinned messages UI fixes [13]

  • Make date-rendering consistent: show year if older than six months [14]

  • Reintroduce black bars around 1:1 remote video [15]

  • Add expire timers to pin/unpin data messages [16]

  • Mark window inactive immediately when blurred [17]

  • Sync and update UI when pinned messages expire [18]

  • Update context menu strings for pin/unpin [19]

  • Release notes for 7.86 [20]

  • Update strings [21]

  • Update DNS fallback [22]

  • Implement megaphone conditional standard_donate with local device createdAt [23]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.62.0 [24]

  • Update to libsignal v0.86.12 [25]

  • Update local backup export UI [26]

  • Ability to click megaphone in narrow sidebar to expand sidebar [27]

  • Conditionally show sidebar view in group calls [28]

  • Show profile name in about contact more often [29]

  • Cleanup after canceled local backup export [30]

  • Animate pinned messages bar [31]

  • Fix pin targeting based on edited timestamp [32]

  • Bind remote config to libsignal-net [33]

  • Add warning when pinning disappearing message [34]

  • Fixes for unpin sync message [35]

  • Add diagnostic information window to Call Quality Survey [36]

  • Add call_diagnostic.html to packaged app build files [37]

  • Fix lightbox image zoom on click [38]

  • Fix pin message dialog submit with no warning step [39]

  • Update CQS logic: remove duration thresholds and add test mode [40]

  • Release notes for 7.87 [41]

  • Update strings [42]

  • 7.87.0-beta.1 [43]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.86.0-beta.1…v7.87.0-beta.1

link_counts.title: Pin a message to top of chat

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
When I pin 3 messages and click on the banner it keeps highlighting the previous one when jumping to the next entry

Basically the highlighting is one behind the displayed pinned message

Also, pinning a message triggers a spinning loading indicator. But that one is gone so fast that it feels like it could be a background job instead

Makes the flow feel disrupted, similar to deleting a message or chat

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.71 release

posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked:
Also, pinning a message triggers a spinning loading indicator

In the desktop client? Could you send me a screenshot or video of the loading spinner you are seeing? We haven’t added any loading spinners for this feature, so I’m not sure where it would be coming from

posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked:
AlertSubject:

When I pin 3 messages and click on the banner it keeps highlighting the previous one when jumping to the next entry

This is intentional, when you click on a pin it should scroll you to that pin and the banner should show you the previous pin so you can repeatedly click to cycle through all of them without scrolling. Or are you seeing some other behavior?

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
Some of my contacts, who I gave a nickname to, get displayed correctly: “nickname (their profile name)”. Others now display only “nickname” (I’ve confirmed, they have actually set another name for their account)
But when I edit the nickname, it gets displayed like this: “newNickname (oldNickname)”.

Looks to me like for some contacts my set nickname gets treated like the actual name they gave themselves?!

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.86.0/4a098ba3409fcbd80db10ba0dd9cca2f7acc4385db7f68a161049f460bb5e9a7.gz

The gray parentheses name should be the name which the other user set for themself in Signal. According to your report, the gray parentheses name is incorrect, it’s definitely the nickname which you specified? (and not something the other user specified?)

Other info that would help:

  1. Are these contacts “System contacts” i.e. synced from your mobile / primary device (In the contact info card, this is the line below “Signal Connection”
  2. Was the nickname applied from Desktop
  3. Did you notice the issue recently / Was it working fine previously?

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
wondering if pins are only available for 1:1 chats at the moment? not seeing the option in any group chats

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.87.0-beta.1/5b746e8401638a87249db7e1c08113c9bfae641512ea50c1c588a51301207ab9.gz

works nicely in 1:1 tho!
You have to be a group admin to see the pin option in the context menu.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

group admin

tbh i’d be hard-pressed to find a group where i’m not xD

found a group where it works and figured out what the issue is:

if “who can edit group info” is set to “only admins”, i can not pin, even if i’m an admin. setting to “all members” makes it possible

awaitlink:

works nicely in 1:1 tho!

that said, clicked on “Go to message” in the chat alert, and got a database error popup, not sure if related to it (it is, happens consistently in 1:1/group) but here’s the log:

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.87.0-beta.1/8945f96d3c0241c2dfa622ab9b929f1151a76c747ce2c730885ff08eb774770f.gz
Damn . That was unexpected.

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked: Sorry I meant to post this in the android beta thread!

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
ayumi-signal:

Are these contacts “System contacts”

Yes, all of them are “in your system contacts”.

ayumi-signal:

Was the nickname applied from Desktop

No, as fast as I remember, all of them were applied on iOS.

ayumi-signal:

Did you notice the issue recently / Was it working fine previously?

I only noticed this recently, so I cannot say if it has changes in any way.

As I mentioned, the behaviour changed from last version to the current version.
Currently, two of my contacts, to whom I have given nicknames, no longer display their own set names.

image900×424 41.2 KB

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.86.0/9f63abd0654cf9123419fb29c59106478b947074f6a036eb5234cfc7d0e937b9.gz

posts.name: Bme13
posts.cooked:
I’m unable to remove the “you pinned a message” message. Btw the log also contains a database error that occurred after clicking on “go to message”.

posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked: This should be fixed in 7.87.0-beta.2, sorry about that

Pinned a message ‘Forever’ and unpinned it. Message got unpinned and clicking the ‘Go to message’ says pinned message not found. Pinned another message for 7 days and unpinned. The banner & the pin icon goes away from the desktop, but shows up on the android device. Also clicking on the ‘Go to message’ take you to the pinned message. Linked Android device shows an alarm is on.

Also I find these tombstones pretty much annoying in the chat. Can they be gotten rid off? Since the pinned messages are there in the banner and pin icon should take you to the pinned messages, this ‘Go to message’ doesn’t seem to be relevant. Perhaps the ‘You pinned a message’ could come as a toast to make sure there is a confirmation than a tombstone!

image377×361 13.2 KB

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Please provide a debug log.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
awaitlink:

found a group where it works and figured out what the issue is:

if “who can edit group info” is set to “only admins”, i can not pin, even if i’m an admin. setting to “all members” makes it possible

just wanted to re-highlight that this is still an issue. the logic is incorrect in desktop, ios lets me pin in this scenario but desktop does not
